website_summaries.verdict: This cordless grass trimmer is ideal for light to medium trimming.
pros: Low-volume motor and fewer maintenance issues to be concerned with make this trimmer ideal for home use
Includes 40 volt MAX 4 amp hour lithium ion battery and charger
Comes with a three-year limited warranty and one year of free service
cons: Some users have had trouble with the trimmer head

customer_reviews.title: If she likes it, nothing else matters...
customer_reviews.text: We got the unit and charged the battery with in one hour. My wife was worried about balance and overall length. After she used it for trimming, she loved it. So far I've only trimmed with it about thirty seconds, it's now her trimmer. She hasn't said it but when she used it, cleaned it and left it on the kitchen table. It's pretty clear who's trimmer it is. I will try to update this post maybe next week by than I may have accrued a full minute of runtime. Oh did I mention one less can of gas and oil mix.
customer_reviews.author: mark

customer_reviews.title: I love the fact it doesn't go so fast that the ...
customer_reviews.text: I run it on low speed and can do my yard twice but haven't tried to run it any more on one charge yet this summer. I love the fact it doesn't go so fast that the line breaks, therefore the line last forever. Haven't had to change line all summer which is nice. The only thing I don't like the shaft is a little bit to long, making it unbalanced and requires two hands. This make it hard when I have to lift the netting around the blackberry's with one hand then trimmer can't be controlled very well.
customer_reviews.author: Janice

customer_reviews.title: Always starts, powerful!
customer_reviews.text: I love this weed eater. It has more power than my old gas powered trimmer. This tool runs through waist high, super tough thistles.. It’s amazing to be able to put it down to move things and not have to yank that gas motor pull start. I’m sold on battery tools. I did buy a chainsaw with the same battery, do can work for an hour and a half in tough tap weeds. I need the 2 batteries. Also, I’ve had trouble finding a source for the heavier dewalt ‘string”. Other brands don’t fit the holes in the feeder, and I’d like to use the heavier string st times. Frustrating!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Work Horse!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome! Now, I must admit. I went into this thinking that it wouldn’t compare to gas powered trimmers but this thing seems to have more instant power than any gas powered trimmer I’ve owned. I’m only 5 weeks into it but I’ve not seen any faults with it. Keeping fingers crossed. Definitely nice not having to go refuel every 30 minutes. The battery lasted over 2 hrs. I had nothing else to trim. It never died.
customer_reviews.author: Glen C.

customer_reviews.title: Strong and powerful but line head sucks!
customer_reviews.text: I had a similar model Dewalt Weedwhacker for three years that was awesome and finally burned out and very sick tall grasses. I received the new one about a week ago. My biggest gripe is that the head jams up and does not dispense the line. I have had to take it apart and rewind several times even though I am very careful about how I wind it up. Frustrating but otherwise the power is comparable to a gas trimmer and the battery outlasts me. It would also be great if it came with the strap.
customer_reviews.author: Occy Joe

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing!
customer_reviews.text: I need to keep a 3 acer lot clear of mostly crazy huge mustard weed and this tears though almost the worst of them. I've used a uncountable amount of weedeaters over the years, but never battery operated Tried a spool of dewalt line, and liked it, but I blew through it too quick to worth the extra cost. So I tried Anleolife square .08 line sold on Amazon and this became the best weed eater I've ever used. Highly recommend. Did buy a second cutting head spool and a second 7. 5 amp battery. Have used it a month, and if this lasts like all my other dewalt tools it was so worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Gemma

customer_reviews.title: Great power and flexibility
customer_reviews.text: Works fantastic! It is great to have the flexibility to go anywhere with it without a cord and NEVER buy gas or have to pull start! Works every time! Great power! Has high and low and setting the high can power through even small saplings!! I have the DeWalt mower also so I can throw the battery in the mower when I’m done edging and finish out the battery before needing the second. I have a pretty good sized lawn so I need a lot of battery time.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Castle

customer_reviews.title: It's a Beast
customer_reviews.text: It's a beast, where's the edger? Very impressed with the trimmer but disappointed I can't get it in an edger. I've used a Ryobi Expand It for 10 years and it's still going strong except for the attachment connection, it's falling apart. This trimmer does the job for my 1/3 acre lot. Not so much b/c of the battery life, but b/c of the power. I've always been hesitant to switch to battery b/c of power!!! My gas mower and gas backpack blower are awesome, and I can't justify replacing those right now but the trimmer and edger are an easy decision. This trimmer works!
customer_reviews.author: George P. Burdell

customer_reviews.title: Overall a pretty good product
customer_reviews.text: Overall a pretty good product. No complaints on the battery life or the performance. I feel like it lives up to the claim of "gasoline performance". I did find it a little hard to use for long periods of time. A shoulder strap could really help. Also, it would be good if they could do something to lessen the amount of vibration that it gives off. My hands feel fatigued for a day or two after using this for a long period of time.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: I really do love this string trimmer, so far at least.
customer_reviews.text: I really do love this string trimmer, so far at least. The battery lasts longer than I do and it happily whacks it's way through some pretty tough stuff even with the stock string. (I am going with one size larger heavier duty Gatorline for the refill, but I haven't had to refill it yet.) Not having to deal with the mess, noise or starting a gas powered one is a huge improvement and that big 40 volt lithium cell runs a long time. I still have an expensive gas Pro Husky, but I haven't used it this year and may never again.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara McCray

customer_reviews.title: Powerful Battery
customer_reviews.text: Extra power here!! I under estimated the power. I should have purchased the smaller battery. this one adds more weight for a string trimmer! I had to purchase an over the shoulder harness to distribute weight of the unit. No need to charge this battery during the season! I will use this battery on the chainsaw instead!!
customer_reviews.author: johnzkoterba

customer_reviews.title: I love this tool!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this tool to accompany my 40-volt chainsaw and I am VERY pleased with my purchase. Using the 7.5 amp battery makes this tool a bit back-heavy "but who cares..." it works great. As a pair, the chainsaw and trimmer are a GREAT combination. No buyers remorse at all.
customer_reviews.author: Lefty

customer_reviews.title: Amazing battery life/runtime poor head/trimmer loading design
customer_reviews.text: This is a great trimmer with lots of power and long battery life for those who have large properties to cover. The trimmer will accept 0.095” line but I don’t think it’s built for it. When ever I use 0.095” line, it gets stuck on the spool and won’t feed. It’s also very difficult and time consuming to load due spool design. I thought the problem was due to age becUse the spool had gotten slightly warped but I brought a new one and had the same problem. I replaced the head with a Husqvarna T35 and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Phill Devey

customer_reviews.title: Low setting is more then enough for home use and battery lasts much longer
customer_reviews.text: Only thing that was wrong was the factory assembled the head incorrectly. The head came apart. After I removed the remaining part I determined that they had installed 2 washers where there should have only been one thus not allowing the fibre locknut to tighten to 1-1/2 threads past the fibre portion. Nut vibrated off and the head came apart. I put it back together using only one washer and the locknut installed correctly and it has been working great since.
customer_reviews.author: horsehead7@excite.com

customer_reviews.title: Great trimmer
customer_reviews.text: There are a lot of reviews claiming this line trimmer is not powerful enough. All I can say is that I am VERY satisfied with how well it works. It is more powerful than my Stihl FS40, which I know is a lower end u it, but the Dewalt is significantly better. I have 2 acres to deal with. This trimmer went through all the grass no sweat (mostly on low), and on blackberries and smaller woody stuff, it worked well on high. Is it the same as a high end gas trimmer? Nope, but it probably lines up with the lower/middle of the Stihl range pretty well. I'm hooked.
customer_reviews.author: John Bregar

customer_reviews.title: Greater product.
customer_reviews.text: This trimmer is very powerful and cuts through just about all kinds of brush and high grass. I worked for four hours the other day with this trimmer and it still had one bar of life on it which would probably equal another hour or two. It beats having to pull a starter cord on the gas trimmers. I highly recommend this to anyone including older people. I am 68 years old and it was no problem using this product.
customer_reviews.author: rural_one

customer_reviews.title: Give your lungs a break.
customer_reviews.text: After more than 20 years of using a gas powered trimmer on a weekly basis (in season), there’s finally a worthy alternative. The trimmer is very powerful, not too heavy, quieter, and most importantly...no exhaust!! Two cycle exhaust is the dirtiest, most unhealthily engine pollution out there and I’m glad there’s one less input coming my way. Aside from that, the trimmer is well balanced with a padded grip, excellent battery, bump-feed spool and plenty power. Very good product.
customer_reviews.author: buddah

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy owner
customer_reviews.text: I bought this with the 6.0 ah battery. I have 3.5 acres and after mowing everything it usually takes me 45 minutes to weed wack the yard. The battery last the whole time and i usually have on average about 1/3 to 2/3 full charge still showing on the battery. Well worth the money of no more cranking or wondering on the gas mixture. You do have to spool the wire still but that is easy to do. . I have had it for 2 months now roughly and i am very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Mariah A.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Tears through underbrush like nothing. This replaced an old corded electric weed eater, and if anything it's more powerful. But really the convenience of going cordless without having to deal with a two stroke engine is a no-brainer. Get it. You'll love it.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew P.

customer_reviews.title: The weight and balance are very good as well
customer_reviews.text: Battery life and performance are outstanding. The weight and balance are very good as well. My reason for the 3 stars is that the trimmer head is not removable so aftermarket trimmer heads can't be used. At least not any that I've found. It's still less hassle than my gas powered trimmer, so I'll keep using it.
customer_reviews.author: pack howitzer

customer_reviews.title: Nice product!
customer_reviews.text: It does throw grass clipping at your legs because the guard is to small, but it does work well. You just have to use a different angle while cutting to avoid that issue. Battery last way long enough for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Bubba Gump

customer_reviews.title: Excellent - but will not take 20v batteries!
customer_reviews.text: It works. Be aware - this is the 40v battery! That battery is like $300. I thought it would work with my other 20v max stuff and was mistaken. Re-reading the description, the seller made that clear - I just missed it I guess. The tool performs well, and the charge lasts a very solid amount of time. I won't be going gas again. My only issue will be if it has durability issues. Been using it for three months and it is still doing its job. If it makes it a year with how I use it I will consider it a win.
customer_reviews.author: Vista Painting & Resurfacing, Inc

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the high price
customer_reviews.text: It's definitely much heavier than my old gas powered weed whacker. I also felt like the power is lagging a little versus a gas powered one. It also kicks out a lot more rocks and crap than my old one...DeWalt definitely skimped on the deflector guard
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with this trimmer
customer_reviews.text: I used this for the first time yesterday and my thumb got tired from holding the trigger down before the battery died. It cut through everything and ate up a lot of line but we had tall, thick grass along a chain link fence. I may try another brand of line to see if it might hold up better. Overall, it's a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Mobile Dog Groomer

customer_reviews.title: Gas performance without the fumes.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this trimmer a few months ago but just used it for the first time today. This powerful unit had no problem cutting down 3 foot weeds in my back yard and after cutting for over an hour the battery still had current. My only fear was being able to replace the the trimmer line but to my surprise it never broke so I didn't have too. Dewalts 0.080 trimmer line is very strong. Overall the unit is well built like all of Dewalts products and this trimmer has the power of gas performance (or close) without the fumes or exhaust. Great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: MM

customer_reviews.title: This is an awesome trimmer. Great power and versatility
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome trimmer. Great power and versatility. Don't run out of string. You'll never get it reloaded. Eventually the entire trimmer assembly came out of the head, so the trimmer is no longer usable. Can't find spare parts. This was far too expensive not to be able to get it fixed. Used my son's cheap trimmer, worked as good, possibly better. Have yet to bother with the string. It automatically extends itself when the string gets low.
customer_reviews.author: Flipper

customer_reviews.title: Great trimmer
customer_reviews.text: So far so good ! Decent run time on the battery, able to get thru my property with a little left over. Only have a third of an acre to trim, so it's not like I have to do the White House lawn. Squeeze the trigger and you go, no more mixing gas, twenty five pulls to get it started. Small engines are a pain, so this cordless unit from Dewalt makes like a little easier. Looks like the line feed will be easy to do and the bump head has worked flawlessly so far. Would recommend this trimmer.
customer_reviews.author: dgw

customer_reviews.title: Better than gas.
customer_reviews.text: Cuts through anything up to. 5". Battery lasts for an hour.... So it cuts through an acre no problem. Prior to this purchase, I had battery anxiety for yard tools..... No longer.
customer_reviews.author: CS Lewis

customer_reviews.title: String trimmer
customer_reviews.text: this thing has power! I was a gas person, but as I get older I wanted something less hassel. Well if you have fears about this not being powerful enough to handle thick brush, don't worry. the battery last quite a long time, I have 1.35 aches and it handled it and then some. Very positive review from me.
customer_reviews.author: Mary I. King

customer_reviews.title: Try a different brand!
customer_reviews.text: First one I bought had a bad battery (would not fully charge). Second one lasted one hour before the motor burned out. Been waiting almost four months to receive a refund under the 90 day trial period. Product is a great idea and easy to use — but too many flaws and poor customer service make it something to avoid. I went back to using my Echo gas powered string trimmer which has never had a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Schreiner

customer_reviews.title: Wonder tool
customer_reviews.text: We had purchased the leaf blower and were pleased and impressed with the ease of use and power. We purchased the string trimmer expecting the same power and quality. We weren't disappointed. This is the best trimmer we have owned. No carburetor issues, a battery that lasts long enough to do the whole yard and the results are wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: J. S. Herrington

customer_reviews.title: This thing is awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Was very skeptical of an electronic weed eater but went ahead and tried the Dewalt upon friends recommendation and man this thing did not disappoint! Performs better than any gas powered I have ever owned and I don’t have to mess with temperamental two stroke starting issues. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Williams

customer_reviews.title: Nice Job Dewalt!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use! As an avid tool purchaser, this is a durable product. The only thing I might have improved is the guard. The guard by the string is rather small in comparison to other brands. Great product though and will be perfect for yard work.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: It ain't cheap, hoping the battery lasts a long time before replacement!
customer_reviews.text: I love it. Powerful motor, long lasting battery, "instant on," no pulling a cord for minutes on end trying to start the engine, which is a concern for people with problem shoulders.
customer_reviews.author: Dusty Roads

customer_reviews.title: and works better than previous gas models I have owned
customer_reviews.text: Powerful grass trimmer, and works better than previous gas models I have owned. Cons: guard is small and may not protect your legs from debris, and unfortunately the battery life only lasted 45 minutes. Recommend buying a second battery.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Mellor

customer_reviews.title: Just what he wanted!
customer_reviews.text: The hubs bought this because he is tired of fighting with batteries that don't last and lines that can't cut a thicker weed. He thought he would need to get thicker line for it, but the line it came with worked perfectly on some thicker weeds we have. It does get a little heavy for him after a while, so we're planning on buying a shoulder strap to shift the weight. It stays strong and doesn't need constant recharging.
customer_reviews.author: Bernadette Fase

customer_reviews.title: More power than the previous generation
customer_reviews.text: Bought the prior generation product a few years back. That's still running well. Bought a 2nd unit thinking it would be like the first. It's better. The motor is more powerful and the battery life is great. Keep building great products DeWalt.
customer_reviews.author: Yo

customer_reviews.title: Wow!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing rips! Lots of power needs charge only after I do the lawn 5 times. My yard is not huge. But this has power of a gas weeded for sure maybe more.
customer_reviews.author: carguy

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: I have been through three battery charges. The battery seems to last about 20 minutes when using full power continuously. I have the next larger battery but have not tried it yet. I usually start getting tired in 20 minutes anyway so it is perfect for me.
customer_reviews.author: Eugene Shaffer

customer_reviews.title: I was sceptical...,
customer_reviews.text: However, having now spent over 40 years keeping gas powered string trimmers operating, I figured I'd give electric a try. So far. after 15 -20 hours of use, I will NOT go back to gas. The trimmer battery stays charged long enough (close to an hour) that this old guy is ready to rest while the battery is recharging. I just hope the battery continues holding a charge for 3 or 4 seasons, because the batteries are way over priced. However, I see there are companies popping up who rebuild rechargeable batteries for a reasonable cost.
customer_reviews.author: Ruthy @ Oroville Holistic

customer_reviews.title: Great trimmer, not so great shipping.
customer_reviews.text: As far as the trimmer goes, i love it. For my needs it works perfectly. One charge gets me through my entire yard with a little left to spare. I finally got sick of messing with gas trimmers and this cordless leaves me with no regrets. The shipping though was horrible. The box was busted open. I was concerned something was missing or damaged but the trimmer works fine and everything was there. Jus wish a little more care was taken to protect the box in transit.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: ... 2 stroke weedeaters my whole life and typically make fun of battery operated lawn equipment
customer_reviews.text: I have had 2 stroke weedeaters my whole life and typically make fun of battery operated lawn equipment. However, this unit is an absolute beast. I have a halh acre yard and it takes care of my yard with no issues at all. I love this weedeater. FYI, it will eat a hole through your wood fence if you are not careful. Very powerful.
customer_reviews.author: gman

customer_reviews.title: but with two speeds can cut the fine grass around the yard
customer_reviews.text: incredible power and long life battery. Somewhat heavy, but with two speeds can cut the fine grass around the yard, or cut down the coarse weeds in the wild. if you have acres of trimming to do, this is your tool. It could use a and over the shoulder strap to carry some of the weight and torque.
customer_reviews.author: KFS

customer_reviews.title: plenty power
customer_reviews.text: This is a real good one. Used to have a Worx; this puts that one to shame. Dewalt makes great stuff, this trimmer included. One complaint: it can't be made more shorter and more compact, which was one nice thing about the Worx, but I still give five stars.
customer_reviews.author: Noel Deering

customer_reviews.title: I had a black and decker 40v battery string trimmer ...
customer_reviews.text: I had a black and decker 40v battery string trimmer before this one and with 2 batteries I couldn't complete half of the trimming around the house. With this one, one battery and I can get the job done. The power does feel close to a gas trimmer.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Vaughn

customer_reviews.title: Not the super power you get from gas (where you worry about ...
customer_reviews.text: Use it to trim about an acre of trees, house, and landscape. I can get about 5 full trims on a charge. Not the super power you get from gas (where you worry about damaging things) but there isn't a weed this hasn't been able to knock down in a residential yard.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Samuel Wagoner

customer_reviews.title: Honeymoon over for this trimmer.
customer_reviews.text: At first this trimmer was great. Now having a great deal of problems with trimmer head. Anyone else having this problem? Carefully winding replacement spools, but line keeps tangling up. Suggestions?
customer_reviews.author: Loves to read good books

customer_reviews.title: So much nicer than a dirty/noisy 2 cycle!!!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome! Do NOT get the 4Ah battery. I did my whole yard on one charge with the 6Ah battery, but just made it. Not enough battery for commercial work, but great for home-owners. So much nicer than a dirty/noisy 2 cycle!!!
customer_reviews.author: Westy

customer_reviews.title: It's like the Duracell rabbit.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent and durable. I use it each week for 45 minutes straight and there us still battery life left. It is heavy and cumbersome but does an outstanding job. Dewalt should have added a strap for easier use.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Newman

customer_reviews.title: Best Trimmer
customer_reviews.text: I love this trimmer. It has plenty of power and I can do my entire yard three times before charging. My only complaint was the price I paid. After purchasing there was a major price drop. I bought the blower and trimmer together and I am very happy with both.
customer_reviews.author: CEB512

customer_reviews.title: I Finally Fought the Grass and Won
customer_reviews.text: I always dreaded the chore of weed eating. This 40 Volt DeWault has simplified the process. I have almost 2 acers, takes about an hour of trimming, No Slow Down, No Lack of Power. Easy feed with just tap. Better than my John Deer and Toro Gas Powered. Perfect so far! Have used it for two months...Thanks for Building This Machine!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Jim

customer_reviews.title: Very powerful
customer_reviews.text: Very powerful, not a typical battery powered trimmer. Very similar to my gas powered one, more than enough power to do my yard twice.
customer_reviews.author: DRKO

customer_reviews.title: I'm glad I went with this trimmer
customer_reviews.text: I'm glad I went with this trimmer. I spent forever reviewing and have no regrets. It is so nice not having to fuss with a gas/pull start trimmer. Just make sure to store the battery where the temperature won't fluctuate a ton and to store it with about 65% charge to make it last the longest that you can.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: it really does a good job.
customer_reviews.text: It takes some getting used to the weight at the battery end but other than that it work's good.
customer_reviews.author: YOTOM

customer_reviews.title: Love This! We have a large tardy and our ...
customer_reviews.text: Love This! We have a large tardy and our old black and decker weedwacker was not holding up to the test. We bought this after it being recommended by a friend and neighbor. It holds up and hasn't needed to be charged even though we have used it three or four times. My only complaint is that it's so long it's a little awkward to pick up but once up is fine. It's got power, watch out the stuff it cuts down comes out flying! Your making a good choice in this product!
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa S Rowe

customer_reviews.title: Motor died after 14 hours
customer_reviews.text: Lasted 2 seasons of very light use for my lawn. The motor died and it just clicks. I'm going back to gas.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Battery is dead and can not contact customer service for warranty
customer_reviews.text: Now I am seeing the trail of poor reviews on Dewalt 40V tools that I wish I had seen before I purchased. The battery is dead and will not take a charge. A replacement battery costs more than the original purchase of the entire trimmer plus battery. A rip off.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine

customer_reviews.title: Powerful
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing. Battery lasts forever. Does a great job. It’s taller than I am ,5 foot even, but I can manage it just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriele Stamp

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and quiet, No Regerts! Mmm Milkyway.
customer_reviews.text: All the power of my gas trimmer, with less than half the maintenance and very quiet. Not sure about string replacement, I’ve used it several times without having to replace the string. I’ve trimmed my 3/4 acre yard with chain link fence twice on a single charge.
customer_reviews.author: Don M.

customer_reviews.title: Happy husband.
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves this trimmer so much, he gave his gas powered Stihl away. We have a large property and he was worried about the DeWalt’s power—no worries!
customer_reviews.author: Windfall1994

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: It is powerful but still does not quite keep up with the gas units. Battery is great for endurance
customer_reviews.author: Dale Charpentier

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: Nice design and well made. Battery life is good. TWCL
customer_reviews.author: TWCL

customer_reviews.title: Good job
customer_reviews.text: Mother in law needed a lightweight battery operated weed eater after knee surgery and this was it. Works very well and she can handle it just fine.
customer_reviews.author: DMAN

customer_reviews.title: A little heavy but a work horse, I would ...
customer_reviews.text: A little heavy but a work horse, I would prefer a string feeder that is not a auto feed it gets tangled and can be tempermental at times.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny P.

customer_reviews.title: Great seller, and would buy from again.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Love Dewalt products and this was a wonderful addition to my yard tools.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Stalsworth

customer_reviews.title: Durability
customer_reviews.text: This is great and has enough power to trim grass as good as gas powered. Not having to pull a power cord is a plus for me. It may be a little heavy but I love it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I have really enjoyed using this weed whacker and the batteries that are ...
customer_reviews.text: I have really enjoyed using this weed whacker and the batteries that are interchangeable with the chainsaw. I like both products and have gotten lots of use from them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Badger head fit's perfect
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Good runtime. Badger head installed easy so much easier to change line with badger head.
customer_reviews.author: m. delehanty

customer_reviews.title: but I absolutely love it.
customer_reviews.text: Incredible tool...tons of power! Battery lasts a LONG TIME. Heavy on the back-end, takes some effort to hold it up and it doesn't feel balanced, so I bought a shoulder harness for it, but I absolutely love it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Performs as good as my gas powered trimmer
customer_reviews.text: Performs as good as my gas powered trimmer. Used it for about 50 minutes and still had about half of the battery left. Relatively quiet no gas and oil mixing. Next spring will probably get the chain saw.
customer_reviews.author: davethewhistleguy

customer_reviews.title: You may need an extra battery!
customer_reviews.text: I liked the machine but the battery died before I could finish the grass. It died within 2.5 hours at low speed.
customer_reviews.author: Romanyah

customer_reviews.title: Short life
customer_reviews.text: Lasted 2 years of steady use before completely dying. Cannot get ahold of DeWalt for warranty.
customer_reviews.author: L

customer_reviews.title: I am very happy with this quiet beast of a machine
customer_reviews.text: Goodbye noisy gas powered string trimmer . I am very happy with this quiet beast of a machine . I highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I bought for this for my husband for his birthday. He loves it. He loves the rechargeable battery and the fact that he can purchase other Dewalt items, such as a leaf blower, and use the battery for those as well.
customer_reviews.author: KMHertz

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: This worked very well. It recently quit. When I called DWALT they are sending a new one. No hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: This product was shipped timely and appears to be a ...
customer_reviews.text: This product was shipped timely and appears to be a quality product but it is a Christmas present for our son so I have not been able to see it in action yet.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Plug in battery and go!
customer_reviews.text: Love it!! No messing with mixing gas/oil!! Worth every penny!!
customer_reviews.author: LaDonna Holleman

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you have a second battery
customer_reviews.text: It’s great. A better mouse trap in every way. The only change I would make: the connecting rod between the battery and motor could be more rigid. Carbon perhaps? Other than that it’s a steal at 200...the batts alone cost 150!
customer_reviews.author: eric miller

customer_reviews.title: but does an excellent job. The battery will keep a charge for ...
customer_reviews.text: Works well! Kind of long, but does an excellent job. The battery will keep a charge for quite some time. The only downside that I can see is what you have to deal with when replacing the cord. Otherwise, if you need more power and runtime, this is worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: mc

customer_reviews.title: I can say I'm pretty pleased. Definitely gas level power and plenty of ...
customer_reviews.text: After using this trimmer for the summer season on my 1 acre property, I can say I'm pretty pleased. Definitely gas level power and plenty of battery (6 AH) for me to finish my mowing job.
customer_reviews.author: R. Mcgee

customer_reviews.title: Great power and battery life
customer_reviews.text: Plenty of power, bumper easily extends more line, 6 Ah battery life is great. You can run it about 1.5-2 hours in a single charge. I’m now looking to buy the lawn mower!
customer_reviews.author: Philip

customer_reviews.title: this thing really works battery lasts long enough to wear ...
customer_reviews.text: this thing really works battery lasts long enough to wear me out. i have lots of trees on an acreage. my son got one after he saw how mine worked and he likes it too
customer_reviews.author: Alvin Gaule

customer_reviews.title: Just what the landscaper ordered
customer_reviews.text: I have had several electric trimmers and this is by far the best. Balances nicely and runs effortlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Davis

customer_reviews.title: Battery power works great.!
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful tool with a strong motor. The 6ah battery holds a strong charge the entire 2 plus acres. This is as good as it comes, just as good as a gas motor.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Behles

customer_reviews.title: Serious trimming done efficiently
customer_reviews.text: The charge holds so well, it lasts longer than I do. It is very powerful and makes quick work of trimming our huge yard.
customer_reviews.author: char

customer_reviews.title: Ling run time
customer_reviews.text: We have a very large yard (approx 100'x300') this weedeater does it all with plenty of charge to spare. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Flatlander

customer_reviews.title: order was filled quickly and arrived faster than i expected
customer_reviews.text: Kinda heavy but still lighter than most gas trimmers, battery lasted as long or longer than a tank and a half of gas, has plenty of power through weeds and very tall grass.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Ruemler

customer_reviews.title: Lots of power
customer_reviews.text: This is a great machine but I am on my second one. The first stopped working within the first two hours of use but they refunded my money and sent me a new one. But, while using this weedeater has a ton of power to get anything done in my yard.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Dewalt Trimmer
customer_reviews.text: Product was delivered undamaged. It's use is as advertised. Recommend a larger amp battery than 40v 4ah.
customer_reviews.author: George A. Leyh

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing
customer_reviews.text: Ah...quiet, no bad gas anymore! For sale...used gas weed eater
customer_reviews.author: Rene' Swor

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Product
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product and I recommend it to everyone! It is DeWalt Quality and so far it's been flawless!
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works better than gas. Played for itself after a couple of years
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Works really well-I'm a 71 year old woman and have ...
customer_reviews.text: Works really well-I'm a 71 year old woman and have no trouble using this. The battery lasts just about as long as I do and it cuts the grass very cleanly and quickly.
customer_reviews.author: katherine r. williams

customer_reviews.title: No more fuss, pull the trigger and go!
customer_reviews.text: Powerful and easy to use. No mess mixing gas and oil. No pulling and pulling to get it to start. Just insert charged battery and you're off. Has all the power of a gas trimmer with all the benefits of a rechargeable! Feels strong and well made, and the battery last long enough to finish large jobs.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie F

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and lightweight
customer_reviews.text: I was a little skeptical at the size of the string but it cuts well and lasted longer than I thought it would.
customer_reviews.author: Nana V

customer_reviews.title: Works good
customer_reviews.text: Works good only annoying thing is it’s longer and heavier than a traditional weed eater
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Mercer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and lasting
customer_reviews.text: Excellent help in small and larger projects. Easy to control and long lasting. With second battery in my blower I can take on much longer tasks.
customer_reviews.author: JCJ

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded Expectations!
customer_reviews.text: Yes it is expensive, yes more then others, and yes best investment I have ever made.
customer_reviews.author: Benton R.

customer_reviews.title: Decent product
customer_reviews.text: Overall a decent trimmer, but it can lack some power trying to trim edges of sidewalks. Overall decent
customer_reviews.author: B.M

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Works as well as my gas weed eater only without the fumes and heat. Opted for the better battery and seems to be worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Billy

product_meta.title: DEWALT 40V MAX XR String Trimmer, 6-Ah Battery (DCST990H1)
product_meta.description: Style:6.0Ah BatteryThe DEWALT DCST990H1 40V MAX XR String Trimmer features a 6 Ah premium high capacity battery (50% more battery capacity) with a brushless motor that provides more runtime and longer life with a more efficient and more durable motor. It has a patented gear drive design that provides more torque and maintains cut speed under load. This is contained within a metal gear case for better durability for heavy use. The impact-resistant Xenoy housing offers maximum durability for every day usage. It has a variable speed trigger which gives you precise speed control when needed with power and performance to tackle thick growth, as well as a padded auxiliary handle that offers comfort for long use. This trimmer has a dual 0.080" line with a bump feed head that gives the user control over the feed rate, along with a 15 inch cutting swath to help you get the job done faster.
feature_bullets: Patented gear drive design housed in a metal gear case for durability
Full variable trigger allows you to have control over the speed and noise
*Maximum initial battery voltage (measured without a workload) is 40 volts. Nominal voltage is 36
Includes 40V MAX 6.0Ah Lithium Ion battery, along with charger

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars420 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
